definition: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
pinyin: Lian2 he2 guo2 Liang2 nong2 Zu3 zhi1

definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries

sentences.english: FAO estimated 37 percent of children suffered from stunting.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國糧農組織估計有37%的兒童遭受發育障礙。

sentences.english: He's just been elected the new Director-General of the UN's Food and Agriculture Organisation, the FAO.
sentences.chinese: 他剛剛被選爲新的聯合國糧農組織的新處長。

sentences.english: In this chapter, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organizations(FAOs) experience with decentralization is briefly reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 簡要回顧了聯合國糧農組織的分權管理經驗。
